title: Directives (Built-in & Custom)
subject: Angular
theory: Directives allow you to attach behavior to DOM elements. Structural directives (start with *) change the DOM layout (add/remove elements). Attribute directives change the appearance or behavior of an element.

examples.explanation: *ngFor iterates over the users array and duplicates the li element for each.

common_mistakes.mistake: Multiple structural directives on one element
common_mistakes.correction: You cannot have *ngIf and *ngFor on the same element. Use an <ng-container> wrapper.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between structural and attribute directives?
interview_questions.answer: Structural directives change DOM layout (add/remove elements) and are prefixed with *. Attribute directives change appearance/behavior.

real_world_use_cases.description: Showing admin panels only if the user has a specific role.

summary: Directives are powerful tools to manipulate the DOM dynamically based on application state.
